page.title: 13TRAFFIC IN LIVINGSTON SOUTH
page.content: On 25th June 1985 we went to the{A71, {West Calder Road,}to take a traffic census. We started at 9.40am.and finished at 9.50am. During that time we saw 84 cars, 1 private coach, 15 lorries, 19 vans, 9 trucks, 1 caravanette, 1 cycle,1 police car, 1 cement mixer, and 1 skip. Although this was not a peak time the road was very busy. The longest time we had to wait for a vehicle to pass was 15 seconds. We also contacted the{Road {Safety Department}who gave us accident figures for the whole of{Livingston, and for the stretch of road between the{Wilderness Roundabout(Bellsquarry) and the{Lizzie Brice Roundabout}on which we did our census. These were respectively 357 accidents in 1983. In 1984, 380 accidents. Three accidents in 1983 and 5 including 1 fatality (a woman cyclist) in 1984.
